report_text: INDICATION: 60-year-old male with hematuria. COMPARISON: None. TECHNIQUE: CT of the abdomen and pelvis without and with intravenous contrast, including delayed images through the kidneys and bladder. FINDINGS: There is a 3.5 cm enhancing mass arising from the lower pole of the left kidney with areas of central necrosis. The mass demonstrates heterogeneous enhancement. The renal vein and IVC are patent without tumor thrombus. No hydronephrosis. A 4 mm nonobstructing calculus is present in the right kidney. No lymphadenopathy. The bladder is normal. IMPRESSION: Enhancing left renal mass suspicious for renal cell carcinoma. Recommend urologic consultation.
report_header: CT ABDOMEN PELVIS WITH AND WITHOUT CONTRAST
impressions: Heterogeneously enhancing 3.5 cm left renal mass with central necrosis, suspicious for renal cell carcinoma. Patent renal vein and IVC without tumor thrombus. Incidental 4 mm right renal calculus. Urologic consultation recommended.

report_text: INDICATION: 38-year-old female with neck swelling and hoarseness. COMPARISON: Ultrasound thyroid dated 2024-04-20. TECHNIQUE: Ultrasound of the thyroid gland with color Doppler. FINDINGS: The right thyroid lobe contains a 2.2 x 1.8 x 1.5 cm solid hypoechoic nodule with irregular margins, microcalcifications, and taller-than-wide shape, corresponding to ACR TI-RADS 5. Increased internal vascularity on Doppler. The left thyroid lobe is heterogeneous without discrete nodules. A suspicious-appearing lymph node measuring 1.3 cm is identified in the right level IV cervical chain with loss of fatty hilum and microcalcifications. IMPRESSION: Highly suspicious right thyroid nodule, ACR TI-RADS 5. Suspicious right level IV lymph node. Recommend FNA biopsy of both lesions.
impressions: Highly suspicious right thyroid nodule measuring 2.2 x 1.8 x 1.5 cm with TI-RADS 5 features including microcalcifications and taller-than-wide morphology. Suspicious right level IV cervical lymph node with microcalcifications. FNA biopsy of both lesions recommended.

report_text: INDICATION: 70-year-old male with sudden onset severe headache. COMPARISON: None. TECHNIQUE: CT angiography of the head performed with intravenous contrast and 3D reconstructions. FINDINGS: There is a 7 mm saccular aneurysm arising from the anterior communicating artery, directed superiorly. Diffuse subarachnoid hemorrhage is present in the basal cisterns, bilateral Sylvian fissures, and interhemispheric fissure, modified Fisher grade 3. Mild hydrocephalus is noted. No intraparenchymal hemorrhage. The remaining intracranial vasculature demonstrates mild atherosclerotic changes without additional aneurysms. IMPRESSION: Anterior communicating artery aneurysm with diffuse subarachnoid hemorrhage, Fisher grade 3. Emergent neurosurgical consultation required.
impressions: 7 mm anterior communicating artery aneurysm as the likely source of diffuse subarachnoid hemorrhage, modified Fisher grade 3. Mild hydrocephalus. Emergent neurosurgical consultation required.

report_text: INDICATION: 48-year-old female with right shoulder pain and limited range of motion. COMPARISON: X-ray right shoulder dated 2024-07-01 showing calcific tendinosis. TECHNIQUE: MRI of the right shoulder without contrast on a 1.5T scanner. Sequences include coronal oblique T2 fat-saturated, sagittal oblique T2, and axial PD. FINDINGS: There is a full-thickness tear of the supraspinatus tendon measuring 1.5 cm in the anteroposterior dimension with 1.2 cm of tendon retraction. Moderate supraspinatus muscle atrophy is present. The infraspinatus and subscapularis tendons are intact. There is a Type II SLAP lesion involving the superior labrum. Moderate subacromial-subdeltoid bursitis is noted. The long head of the biceps tendon is intact within the bicipital groove. IMPRESSION: Full-thickness supraspinatus tendon tear with moderate retraction and muscle atrophy. Type II SLAP tear. Moderate subacromial bursitis.
impressions: Full-thickness supraspinatus tendon tear measuring 1.5 cm AP with 1.2 cm retraction and moderate muscle atrophy. Type II SLAP tear of the superior labrum. Moderate subacromial-subdeltoid bursitis.

report_text: INDICATION: 22-year-old male status post motor vehicle collision with abdominal pain. COMPARISON: None. TECHNIQUE: CT of the abdomen and pelvis with intravenous contrast, trauma protocol. FINDINGS: There is a grade III splenic laceration involving the splenic hilum with active contrast extravasation indicating active hemorrhage. Moderate hemoperitoneum is present in the perisplenic space, paracolic gutters, and pelvis. The liver, kidneys, and pancreas are unremarkable. No pneumoperitoneum. Fractures of the left 9th and 10th ribs are identified. No pneumothorax. IMPRESSION: Grade III splenic laceration with active hemorrhage and moderate hemoperitoneum. Left rib fractures. Emergent surgical evaluation required.
report_header: CT ABDOMEN PELVIS WITH CONTRAST TRAUMA PROTOCOL

findings.observation: grade III laceration with active hemorrhage

impressions: Grade III splenic laceration with active contrast extravasation indicating active hemorrhage. Moderate hemoperitoneum. Left 9th and 10th rib fractures. Emergent surgical evaluation required.
